body:
Hello @Espade, thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our [Custom Training Tutorial](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) to get started, and see our [Google Colab Notebook](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb), [Docker Image](https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3), and [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) for example environments. 
  
If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and **minimum viable code to reproduce your issue**, otherwise we can not help you.

@Espade you can modify the cfg as you see fit, but yes you must renumber the route and shortcut 'from' attributes accordingly.

And as you see in your error, you must also keep in mind the sizes and shapes of the input data  and how your convolution affects them. I'd recommend using netron to visualize your changes.

> @Espade you can modify the cfg as you see fit, but yes you must renumber the route and shortcut 'from' attributes accordingly.
> 
> And as you see in your error, you must also keep in mind the sizes and shapes of the input data and how your convolution affects them. I'd recommend using netron to visualize your changes.

Hi, thank you for your quick reply. I have 2 questions:
1: the 'from' attribute is mostly a negative number, eg"-1, -2, -3", how do I adjust these numbers? Because negative numbers are indexed from the current layer.
2: How do I use netron to visualize? I never used it before.

@Espade they are the same as any python indexing. If the relative index doesn't change, then don't change it.

Use https://github.com/lutzroeder/netron for cfgs
One more question: img_size parameter means the resized image shape, does it affect the network input resolution? Does it have any constraint in img_size?
What does width and height do in yolov3-spp.cfg?

All training settings are defined via Argparser and hyp dictionary in train.py.

Cfg is only used for model architecture.
Yeah, thank you. I am wondering what is the relationship between img-size via Argparser and width & height in Cfg?
@Espade cfg is only used for model architecture. argparser defines image sizes.
Yeah, definitely. My question is: does img-size must be the same as width height in model architecture?
@Espade none of the training settings are at all are used from the cfg. There are no constraints of the sort you mention. All training settings are determined via the argparser.

Yeah, I know. Cfg is used for model building, argparse is used for training settings. My question is: if the image size is different from the input dimension of the network, how can the yolo model work?
Any yolo model can run on any size image.
Why? Yolo cfg has defined the input dimension.

@Espade I already told you, none of the training settings in the cfg at all are used in this repository. The dimensions in the cfg are completely ignored in this repository. They are only used in darknet.
